title: How to Make Fluffy Scrambled Eggs the British Way

steps.headline: Start with eggs at room temperature.
steps.description: If just out of the fridge, you can still get them right.

steps.headline: Use a non-stick saucepan, not a skillet.
Spray with a non-stick spray when pan is cool.
Break eggs into bowl.
steps.description: If you want extra protein, use two eggs, but discard the yolk of one. (Egg whites alone don't really get fluffy. Besides, the yolk is nutrient-dense.)

steps.headline: Add a small amount of milk or water and beat a few times with a fork.
Put the mixture into the unheated pan and use LOW heat.
steps.description: Beat the egg mixture a few times and gradually increase the heat to medium. Beat a few times and increase heat to medium-high. You'll see the eggs cooking.

text: Start with eggs at room temperature. If just out of the fridge, you can still get them right. Use a non-stick saucepan, not a skillet.  Spray with a non-stick spray when pan is cool.  Break eggs into bowl. If you want extra protein, use two eggs, but discard the yolk of one. (Egg whites alone don't really get fluffy. Besides, the yolk is nutrient-dense.) Add a small amount of milk or water and beat a few times with a fork.  Put the mixture into the unheated pan and use LOW heat. Beat the egg mixture a few times and gradually increase the heat to medium. Beat a few times and increase heat to medium-high. You'll see the eggs cooking. Continue until they are done.
